info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 3:53PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EASTERN HARDING AND SOUTHEASTERN UNION COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM MDT... At 353 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles south of Mount Dora, or 17 miles southwest of Clayton, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sedan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
